SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: All requirements focus on providing intuitive and accessible interfaces for users to manage settings or participate in events.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Intuitive and Accessible Interface for Settings and Events
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system shall provide an intuitive and accessible interface for users to manage privacy settings and participate in virtual events, with options for voice guidance and one-click functionality.

SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: All requirements emphasize high usability and accessibility, particularly for users with varying technical abilities.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: P-007-NFR-002 targets older adults, P-006-NFR-001 focuses on caregivers, P-002-NFR-001 emphasizes voice interaction, P-004-NFR-003 adapts the interface based on user ability, and P-001-NFR-001 caters to low-tech literacy users.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Highly Usable and Adaptive Interface for Diverse Users
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system shall feature a highly usable and adaptive interface designed to cater to diverse user groups, including older adults, caregivers, and users with varying technical abilities, ensuring intuitive navigation and accessibility.

SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: Both requirements focus on simplifying user interactions with the system, particularly for managing clients and participating in events.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: P-006-FR-002 is tailored for caregivers managing multiple clients, while P-004-FR-003 is designed for patients participating in virtual events.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Simplified Interaction for Caregivers and Patients
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system shall offer simplified and intuitive interfaces for caregivers to manage client data and for patients to participate in virtual events, ensuring ease of use and efficiency.

Conflicts.Note: P-002-FR-001 emphasizes voice-guided interaction for event participation, while P-004-FR-003 focuses on one-click join functionality. This creates a conflict in interaction modality, as one persona prefers voice guidance while the other prefers a simpler, one-click approach.

Conflicts.PersonaConflict: Older Adults (UC-002, UC-003, UC-005) vs Caregivers (UC-002, UC-005, UC-006)
Conflicts.Note: P-007-NFR-002 aims for a user-friendly interface for older adults, while P-006-NFR-001 targets a highly usable interface for caregivers. This creates a potential conflict in balancing personalization for older adults with the need for consistency and efficiency for caregivers.
